newsitem.title: JAPAN: LTCB says to cut Dec long-term prime to 2.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: LTCB says to cut Dec long-term prime to 2.5 pct.

text.p: The Long-Term Credit Bank of Japan Ltd said on Tuesday it was cutting its long-term prime rate by 0.2 percentage point to a record low 2.5 percent for December, effective from Wednesday.
The bank also said it would slash the coupon rate of its new December five-year bank debentures to 1.8 percent from 2.0 percent in November.
The announcement of the change in the long-term prime rate follows a similar move announced by the Industrial Bank of Japan Ltd on Monday.
LTCB's 2.0 percent November five-year bank debentures were tagged with a sell quote of 1.82 percent on Tuesday, a brokerage trader said.
Bank debentures are the major fund-raising tool of the three Japanese long-term credit banks.
